answers.answer: Has your vet run a complete blood workup on your dog?  Most dogs this young are chow hounds - there might be something else going on - like diabetes.  Refusing to eat (or not eating much) is a warning sign that something is going on.

Since your doggie is favoring one side of his head he may have an ear infection.  When they are experiencing  pain one of the signs can be a loss of appetite.  If he did not have a complete physical and bloodwork done I would return to the vet and get this done.  Loos of appetite can be a clinical sign of many different things.  Bloodwork can help to narrow the guess-work down so the vet can get a diagnosis.  In the meantime boiling lean chicken or lean ground beef (make little meatballs) and rice may help.  Feed these to him warm as that intensifies their aroma.  Hope he is feeling better soon.
No my vet has not run tests on him yet so i will take him to get blood work done,yes he really should be eating more thanks for you opinion

Yes I am returning to get complete physical and blood work done now he is quiet thin his ribs show a little, he never eats a full bowl of food and this is worrying and this is a small bowl ive tried everything nuts and dog food .Thank you for your reply.

question: Hello I have a small dog he is over a year old and he doesnt eat that much only bits and pieces, I had him to the vet and he suggested giving him a small bowl of nuts and just give him that but that did not work and now he just eats small  pieces of chicken nothing regular really. Is there any appetiser available for dogs. He also has a sore ear  which  is red on the inside and he yields to it when he scrathes it particularly at night. Is there any cure for this? thank you.
title: my dog sandie
